column4: Hi I am getting this error - Xlib:  extension "XFree86-DRI" missing on display ":1.0"   - how can I fix it ?
disable the dri part in your xorg.conf
can you remind me where xorg.conf is please ?
#       Load    "dri"
it's located in the "Module" section
Load  "glx" ?
don't you have a load dri ?
thats the only thing in -> Section "Module"
look into the xorg.conf for dri
there is no entry like that
that's strange
did you try to google your error ?
yes I did and I have been going around in little circles for a few hours :)
can you give me the exact error again please ?
--- > Xlib:  extension "XFree86-DRI" missing on display ":1.0"
I get that error when I run regedit to tweak wine
nvidia ?
ati
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=292642&highlight=Xlib%253A+extension+XFree86-DRI%2526quot%253B+missing+on+display+%2526quot%253B%253A0.0.
I tried everything there and just tried ---> adding Section "Extensions"
I've just noticed this in xorg.conf --> Section "Device"
somehow the ati driver wasnt enabled anymore but I have re-enabled it and rebooted and it still is giving me that error
